instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
Hey everybody and Happy New Year

I've got an issue with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A board. Customer brought it after another shop repair attempt. The board had minor oxidation around jtag port and J8300.

<RESISTOR>R8317</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R8318</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8302</CAPACITOR> were knocked off. After replacing them I'm still missing some voltages:

[I]MEASUREMENTS[/I]
[B]J8300[/B]
Pin1 : 0V
Pin2 : 0V
Pin3 : 5V
Pin4 : 5V
Pin5 : 3.3V
Pin6 : 3.3V
Pin7 : 3.3V
Pin8 : 3.3V
Pin9 : 0V
Pin10 : 0V
Pin11 : 0V
Pin12 : 3V
Pin13 -> Pin30 : 0V

[B]L8300[/B]
5V on both ends

[B]<CHIP>U7700</CHIP>[/B]
Pin0 : 0V
Pin5 : 5V
[I]diode mode[/I]
pin15 : 0.5
pin16 : 0.5[I][/I]

[B]<CHIP>U8330</CHIP>[/B]
Pin1 : 0V
Pin8 : 3.3V

[B]<CHIP>U8340</CHIP>[/B]
pin1 : 0V
Pin5 : 3.3V

Don't know where else to look but it seems that <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> can't get enabled.

thanks for your support

And have a great 2023 !!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
"Pin30 : 0V
..............
[B]L8300[/B]
5V on both ends"
Broken trace???

Don't waste time with backlight searching; LCD is not recognized yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
thanks for your reply

oh I forgot to mention all measurement were done without LCD connected

here how <RESISTOR>R8317</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R8318</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C8302</CAPACITOR> are connected

now with the lcd connected, i'm getting :

on J8300 pin 12 : 1.5V
on L8300 : 0V on both ends

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
ALWAYS check voltage and signals on LCD connector WITH LCD connected!

L8300 voltage must appear in the first few seconds, when the machine chimes.
<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> must go high (2.5V) at same time; if not, 5V LCD (L8300) will disappear.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
ok just replaced J8300 (to be sure)

L8300 go indeed to 2.5V for a few seconds (not 5V anymore)
<SIGNAL>LCD_HPD_CONN</SIGNAL> (<CAPACITOR>C8353</CAPACITOR>) goes high but very quickly, don't have time to spot exact voltage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
now with the lcd connected and open lid I do get 5V on L8300

and 5V on pin 28,29,30 on J8300

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
You've checked first without LCD and next with panel closed (even LCD was connected)?
Please, put some logic in the repair process.
You can't expect image/backlight, if Hall sensor pulls down <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>.

Use a flashlight and check if at least image is present.
It should, if now you have steady 5V at J8300.

threads.message:
true true

sorry having a hangover since yesterday <SIGNAL>O_O</SIGNAL>

so when I plug the ssd and speakers I do have a chime and a backlight but [U]no image[/U] and fan at max level

I do get 
on [B]J8300[/B]
40V on pin1 
5V on pin 28,29,30

[B]L7710 [/B]- 10V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message: Check all <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-28 caps and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - No image - [SOLVED]
threads.message:
